item.title: OpenShift 4 Lab: Libvirt Baremetal UPI
item.description: Hello everyone, just a couple of month ago, Red Hat has released a shiny OpenShift 4 based on CoreOS technology. In this guide, we going to see how we can install OCP4 UPI on libvirt. What is UPI and IPI? UPI: User Provided Infrastructure (User manually prepare machine for bootstrap) IPI: Installer Provided Infrastructure (OCP Installer automatically terraforming machine for bootstrap) PreReq A Valid Red Hat OpenShift subscription DNS Server (Helper Node) HAProxy Server (Helper Node) DHCP Server (Helper Node) PXE/TFTP Server (Helper Node) Libvirt Host VM Requirement: Node vCPU Memory(GB) Disk(GB) OS Hostname Count Helper(Bastion) 4 4 50 RHEL 8 helper.
